text: <!channel> do we have any licenses for xScope laying around? <http://xscopeapp.com/>

attachments.text: xScope is a powerful set of tools for Mac OS X that are ideal for measuring, aligning and inspecting on-screen graphics and layouts.
attachments.fallback: xScope is a powerful set of tools for Mac OS X that are ideal for measuring, aligning and inspecting on-screen graphics and layouts.

text: <@U02618EV1> : you've looked into this kind of stuff, right?
I LOVE xscope. Have my own personal license, though.
They have demo, though, you could use it until you get the license.
You know, I just paid for the new version. You could use the code for the older version if you don't mind. It's equally awesome.
let me see if it solves the problem I have
actually, the thing I was trying to think of was xRay Editor, not xScope
and xRay is only for iOS :/

attachments.text: Provides debugging area help for Xcode.
attachments.fallback: Provides debugging area help for Xcode.

text: doesn't show me the view attributes (background color, opaque, alpha) but it does give me a sense of the view hierarchy, which is helpful
